Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with top of handle zone; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; trace of part of lotus flower in added red and white; below, two or three faded white bands; top of rim glazed; exterior: part of black-dotted haunch and body of an animal, possibly a hare, to right; below, black line at junction with bowl above a curved line, possibly part of guilloche.
Curator's comments: Lemos places the sherd in the Wild Goat Style. The presence of interior decoration, the lack of rim decoration and of filling ornaments suggest that the sherd is later, possibly in the Simple Animal Style. Hares rarely feature on Chian fine wares. There are perhaps only two examples of hares on Chian fine ware from Naukratis. See British Museum 1924,1201.152.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 243, no. 248)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1038) (phase 2)
